{{Infobox_Broadcast | call_letters = XHIMT | station_logo = | station_slogan = El 7: Te damos de quÃ© hablar ''(We give you what for talk about)''. | station_branding = El 7 (''The 7'') | analog = 7 ([[very high frequency|VHF]]) | digital = 24 ([[Ultra high frequency|UHF]]) | affiliations = [[Azteca 7|El 7]] | founded = May 15, 1985 | location = [[Mexico City]], [[Mexico]] | callsign_meaning = '''XH''' '''I'''nstituto '''M'''exicano de la '''T'''elevision
''(former public broadcaster, before going private as TV Azteca)'' | owner = [[TV Azteca]] | former_callsigns = | former_affiliations = | effective_radiated_power = 266.8 kW (analog) | homepage = http://azteca7.com/ }} '''XHIMT''' is the callsign for the over the air [[Azteca 7]] (also known as El 7) network flagship station in Mexico City (Channel 7 analog and Channel 24 digital). XHIMT provides some [[HDTV|HD]] programming to cable and satellite viewers. ==History== XHIMT was one of three stations originally owned and operated by ImevisiÃ³n, a Mexican public broadcaster ([[XHDF-TV]] and [[XEIMT-TV]] were the others). At the beginning of the 1990s, this station suffered problems with its signal, resulting in being declared for sale in 1991. That year, it transmitted signal to bind with the [[XHDF-TV|Azteca 13]] as ImevisiÃ³n's sale continued. In [[1993]] this channel, together with XHDF, were sold to became part of the new commercial TV Azteca network, when the Mexican government finally dissolved [[ImevisiÃ³n]]. ==Programming== Daytime programming consists of original news, cartoons, series and movies. Most of El 7's primetime programming consists of Spanish translated American programs and movies. Some of them are divided into themed days. An example is: ===Tempation Tuesdays (Martes de TentaciÃ³n)=== *[[Ghost Whisperer]] (Almas Perdidas) *[[Desperate Housewives]] (Esposas Deseperadas) *[[Bones (TV series)|Bones]] ===Chaos Thursdays (Jueves de Kaos)=== *DÃ­ficil de Creer (''Hard to Believe'') [Produced by TV Azteca] *[[Grey's Anatomy]] (Grey) *Tuneame la nave *[[Flashpoint (TV series)|Flashpoint]] ===Irreversible Fridays (Viernes Irreversible)=== *[[WWE Friday Night SmackDown|WWE SmackDown]] *Lo Que la Gente Cuenta (''What the People Say'') [Produced by TV Azteca] ===Prime time=== {{see|List of programs broadcast by TV Azteca}} {{Mexico City TV}} {{Mexican broadcast television}} [[Category:Azteca 7 affiliates]] [[Category:Television stations in Mexico City]] [[Category:Channel 7 TV stations in Mexico]] [[Category:Spanish-language television stations in Mexico]] {{Mexico-tv-station-stub}} [[es:XHIMT-TV]] [[pt:Azteca 7]]
